climbs.name: Whipping on a Can of Beans

content.description:
Climb either the crack or the large Huecos just right of the crack with decent large pro in the crack.  Crux is the start.

If someone has an earlier FA, I will revise.
content.location: On the collection of rocks N of the John Yablonski Rock proper and east of Sandy Wash, facing the road.  A large crack on the far left side

content.description: Start as for Lunge for it, but go straight up over small bulge and then top out on slopers and a crack higher up.  Falling off top lands you in a bush frequented by bees.
content.location: Right side of Sandy Wash corridor

content.description:
A fun highball with a scary crux near the top.

Start easily up the thin crack, and gain a good ledge below the widening crack.

Layback the crack for a scary sequence until possible to move into the wide top part of the crack.
content.location: This route lies on the South Face to the East of the wash.

climbs.name: Lunge For It (aka All Lunged Out)

content.description: At the right end of the All Washed Up wall, boulder up to a prominent horizontal 10' off the ground and traverse left about 6' to a good pair of slopey holds on the rail. Decent feet set you up for a pretty easy dyno to the sloping rail above. Can chew your hand a little if you keep missing it but much easier than the dyno of Saturday Night Live, for instance. Could probably be done statically. Definitely a fun little problem. A perplexing direct start exists but without more or less lunging off the ground looks hard (supposedly V4)

The left side of the face, climb obvious small crimps up overhanging rock of excellent quality. At the higher horizontal somewhat larger crimps provide a bit of relief as you figure out how to negotiate the completely blank, rounded topout and get to that jug that's too far away :) Totally awesome problems and reasonably straightforward for the grade compared to some of Joshua Tree's classic "blank" nightmares!
content.protection: Pad. A bit high - you face a 10-12 foot fall at the crux, make sure you have a good spot and/or don't miss your pad.
